situation: P was unable to start his science project, staring at his blank paper in frustration and tapping his pencil loudly.
action: Helped P break down the project into smaller, manageable tasks and set short, timed goals for each part. Provided one-on-one supervision to keep him on track.
effect: P felt more empowered and was able to start and make significant progress on his project, displaying reduced frustration and increased productivity.
